documentType: arrest warrant and prisoner processing forms
summary: This document set includes a federal arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein issued on July 2, 2019, and associated US Marshals Service prisoner processing forms. The warrant charges Epstein with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. The forms detail the administrative procedures for his arrest and intake into custody.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual named in the federal arrest warrant for sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. Listed as the prisoner on USMS processing forms.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: The magistrate judge who signed the arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Alton Moe
persons.context: The AUSA whose name and telephone number are listed on the arrest warrant form.

events.title: Arrest Warrant Issued for Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A federal arrest warrant is issued by Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses, commanding law enforcement to arrest Jeffrey Epstein on charges of sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was formally charged via federal arrest warrant on July 2, 2019, with violations of Title 18, U.S. Code, Sections 371 (sex trafficking conspiracy) and 1591(a), (b)(2) (sex trafficking of minors).
The arrest warrant was signed by United States Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses.
The documents include standard US Marshals Service prisoner processing forms, indicating the administrative procedures followed upon his arrest.
The prisoner processing forms list the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in Brooklyn as a relevant facility.
Assistant United States Attorney Alton Moe is listed as a contact on the arrest warrant.
